BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: MISSOURI BOTANICAL GARDEN BOARD OF TRUSTEES

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To discover and share knowledge about plants and their environment in order to preserve and enrich life.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To discover and share knowledge about plants and their environment in order to preserve and enrich life.
IRS990.Desc: Horticulture: During 2015, 1,133,484 visitors came to the Missouri Botanical Garden and other Garden sites to view the collection of indoor and outdoor plants. Plant holdings grew by 2,194 perennial accessions to the total collection.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Science and Conservation: The Missouri Botanical Garden is recognized world wide as the leading institution in tropical, botanical systematics, and training. The Garden's collection of plant specimens totals 6,665,871.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Education: The purpose of the Education program is to foster knowledge and awareness of the plant world environment and natural history. There were 328,566 students, adults and teachers who participated in lectures, workshops, symposiums and tours.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Other program services: Visitor services $478,924 and Other miscellaneous program expenses (shared) $1,141,933
Professional Services (offsetting income is included in grants and contracts)
The Butterfly House operations (other than retail) (revenue from contributions are included elsewhere)
Retail Shops (revenue from contributions are included elsewhere)
Neighborhood Redevelopment (offsetting income is included in grants and contracts)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Garden holds sculptures and other artwork for display. The sculptures and artwork add to the experience of visitors and encourages visits to the Garden. The Garden also holds a book collection relating to botanical matters. It is valuable as a research resource and is maintained for future generations.
The endowment funds are used to support operating expenses.

The Garden is a not-for-profit trust, exempt from Federal income tax under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and none of its present or anticipated future activities are subject to taxation as unrelated business income. Therefore, no provision for income taxes has been made in the accompanying financial statements. The Garden follows the provisions of ASC 740-10-25, Income Taxes, requiring disclosure of uncertain tax positions. There have been no interest or penalties neither recognized in the statements of activities nor in the statements of financial position related to uncertain tax positions. In addition, no tax positions exist for which it is reasonably possible that the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits will significantly increase or decrease within the next 12 months. The Garden evaluates its uncertain tax positions, if any, on a continual basis through review of its policies and procedures, review of its regular tax filings, and discussions with outside experts.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: Russia and the newly independent States

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.RegionTxt: Russia and the newly independent States

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.MannerOfCashDisbursementTxt: Wired fund or cash or check

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: Raise funds through phone solicitation for the capital campaign and assist in the membership renewal effort. Residual revenue is to be received in future years.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Garden requires that applicants submit a proposal for consideration in the grants fellowship program. The proposals must be received by a stated deadline and should be submitted utilizing a standardized format available on the Garden's website. In order for a proposal to be considered in the competition, the applicant must meet stated criteria defined in the proposal application form. The proposals received are reviewed by a Committee comprised of Garden scientists who evaluate the applications based on predefined criteria. Once the selection is made, the applicants are notified of their award. Each grantee must submit a final report at the end of the fellowship period. The Garden provides annual reports to the donors describing the accomplishments of the fellows who received their support.
The President is required to live on the Garden premises per the Trust. In addition, the Garden provides the President with a membership to a social club to use for business pruposes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Lents & Associates, a public relations firm, manages the Communications Department.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The tax return was reviewed by the Organization's tax counsel and by the external auditors' tax department prior to the presentation to the Audit Committee of the Board of Trustees for their review. A copy of the return was then provided to the full board of trustees for their review prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: If conflicts are presented, they are researched and appropriately addressed per documented policies.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: An independent Trustee compensation committee, in consultation with the Organization's legal counsel, reviews the President's performance and sets his compensation. This review occurred in 2015. The President, in consultation with the Vice President, Human Resources, reviews performance and sets compensation for key employees identified in Part VII of this Form 990, which is also reviewed by an independent Trustee compensation committee. These reviews occurred in 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: An annual report, including the financial statements, is issued by the Membership Department to members. The annual report, annual audit and Form 990 are available on the Organization's website. The governing documents are available upon request.
Other changes in fund balances: Transfers to MBG Properties - $125,018 and Change in value of annuity agreements - $369,848. Total amount of change to fund balance = $244,830.
